DOCNAME: CASE OF HAVLICKOVA v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant lives in ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , having been divorced on DATE , lodged an action with ORG ( okresní soud ) for the separation of the matrimonial property .

CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court held CARDINAL hearings . On DATE and DATE it appointed CARDINAL experts with a view to evaluating real estate , antiques and jewellery . Subsequent hearings were held on CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE . In the meantime , the expert in real estate delivered his opinion . Another hearing was scheduled for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE a new expert opinion concerning the real estate was submitted to the court , which had appointed another expert in antiques and jewellery .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered a new expert opinion concerning the real estate . The expert submitted his report on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transmitted to another judge at ORG .
CARDINAL . Two hearings were held on DATE and DATE . The parties expressed their wish to reach a friendly settlement . The last hearing was therefore adjourned sine die .

CARDINAL . As the parties had not informed the court about a friendly settlement , a hearing was held on DATE . It was adjourned in order to evaluate the antiques and jewellery claim . Moreover , the applicant was invited to submit the address of a witness she had suggested be heard .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court appointed a new expert in real estate . The expert submitted his opinion in DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE , ORG held hearings . The applicant did not attend the last hearing , being in GPE . The court therefore adjourned the hearing sine die .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer informed the court that her client had returned to GPE and that a friendly settlement of the case was not excluded . On DATE she informed the court of the continuation of the dispute . On DATE the applicant notified the court that she would be abroad until DATE .

CARDINAL . A hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned at the request of the applicant ’s lawyer until DATE . At this hearing , the defendant challenged the judge for bias . On DATE the PERSON Regional Court ( krajský soud ) decided that the judge was not biased , and remitted the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . A hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned , the defendant being ill .

CARDINAL . A hearing held on DATE was adjourned sine die , the parties not agreeing on the value of the antiques and jewellery . The court requested ORG to submit written opinions as the defendant claimed that certain antiques had been stolen in DATE .
CARDINAL . It appears that the proceedings are still pending at first instance .
